member.name: F:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.GroupPrincipal._isSmallGroup
member.summary: if isSmallGroup has a value, it means we already checked if the group is small

member.name: P:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.GroupPrincipal.SmallGroupMemberSearchResult
member.summary: cache the search result for the member attribute it will only be set for small groups!

member.name: M:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.GroupPrincipal.IsSmallGroup
member.summary: Finds if the group is "small", meaning that it has less than MaxValRange values (usually 1500) The property list for the searcher of a group has "member" attribute. if there are more results than MaxValRange, there will also be a "member;range=..." attribute we can cache the result and don't fear from changes through Add/Remove/Save because the completed/pending lists are looked up before the actual values are

member.name: T:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ADDNConstraintLinkedAttrSet.ResultValidator
member.summary:
Result validator - Delegate function signature.
The result validator should return true if the result is valid and false if the result is invalid and needs to be skipped.
member.param: Directory entry object of the result. NOTE: ADDNLinkedAttrSet class is responsible for disposing this DirectoryEntry object.
member.returns: True - if the result is valid (further processing with the result will happen in this case) False - If the result is invalid. In this case the result will skipped.

member.name: M:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ADStoreCtx.IsLockedOut(System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.AuthenticablePrincipal)
member.summary: Determine if principal account is locked. First read User-Account-control-computed from the DE. On Uplevel platforms this computed attribute will exist and we can just check bit 0x0010. On DL platforms this attribute does not exist so we must read lockoutTime and return locked if this is greater than 0
member.returns: true is account is locked, false if not

member.name: M:System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.ADStoreCtx.UnlockAccount(System.DirectoryServices.AccountManagement.AuthenticablePrincipal)
member.summary: Unlock account by setting LockoutTime to 0

members.member: First check direct group membership by using DE.IsMember If this fails then we may have a ForeignSecurityPrincipal so search for Foreign Security Principals With the p's SID and then call IsMember with the ADS Path returned from the search.

member.name: T:Interop.BOOL
member.summary: Blittable version of Windows BOOL type. It is convenient in situations where manual marshalling is required, or to avoid overhead of regular bool marshalling.
member.remarks: Some Windows APIs return arbitrary integer values although the return type is defined as BOOL. It is best to never compare BOOL to TRUE. Always use bResult != BOOL.FALSE or bResult == BOOL.FALSE .

member.name: T:Interop.BOOLEAN
member.summary: Blittable version of Windows BOOLEAN type. It is convenient in situations where manual marshalling is required, or to avoid overhead of regular bool marshalling.
member.remarks: Some Windows APIs return arbitrary integer values although the return type is defined as BOOLEAN. It is best to never compare BOOLEAN to TRUE. Always use bResult != BOOLEAN.FALSE or bResult == BOOLEAN.FALSE .

member.name: T:Interop.OBJECT_ATTRIBUTES
member.summary: OBJECT_ATTRIBUTES structure. The OBJECT_ATTRIBUTES structure specifies attributes that can be applied to objects or object handles by routines that create objects and/or return handles to objects.

member.name: F:Interop.OBJECT_ATTRIBUTES.RootDirectory
member.summary: Optional handle to root object directory for the given ObjectName. Can be a file system directory or object manager directory.

member.name: F:Interop.OBJECT_ATTRIBUTES.ObjectName
member.summary: Name of the object. Must be fully qualified if RootDirectory isn't set. Otherwise is relative to RootDirectory.

member.name: F:Interop.OBJECT_ATTRIBUTES.SecurityDescriptor
member.summary: If null, object will receive default security settings.

member.name: F:Interop.OBJECT_ATTRIBUTES.SecurityQualityOfService
member.summary: Optional quality of service to be applied to the object. Used to indicate security impersonation level and context tracking mode (dynamic or static).

member.name: M:Interop.OBJECT_ATTRIBUTES.#ctor(Interop.UNICODE_STRING*,Interop.ObjectAttributes,System.IntPtr,Interop.SECURITY_QUALITY_OF_SERVICE*)
member.summary: Equivalent of InitializeObjectAttributes macro with the exception that you can directly set SQOS.

member.name: F:Interop.ObjectAttributes.OBJ_INHERIT
member.summary: This handle can be inherited by child processes of the current process.

member.name: F:Interop.ObjectAttributes.OBJ_PERMANENT
member.summary: This flag only applies to objects that are named within the object manager. By default, such objects are deleted when all open handles to them are closed. If this flag is specified, the object is not deleted when all open handles are closed.

member.name: F:Interop.ObjectAttributes.OBJ_EXCLUSIVE
member.summary: Only a single handle can be open for this object.

member.name: F:Interop.ObjectAttributes.OBJ_CASE_INSENSITIVE
member.summary: Lookups for this object should be case insensitive.

member.name: F:Interop.ObjectAttributes.OBJ_OPENIF
member.summary: Create on existing object should open, not fail with STATUS_OBJECT_NAME_COLLISION.

member.name: F:Interop.ObjectAttributes.OBJ_OPENLINK
member.summary: Open the symbolic link, not its target.

member.name: T:Interop.SECURITY_QUALITY_OF_SERVICE
member.summary: SECURITY_QUALITY_OF_SERVICE structure. Used to support client impersonation. Client specifies this to a server to allow it to impersonate the client.

member.name: T:Interop.ImpersonationLevel
member.summary: SECURITY_IMPERSONATION_LEVEL enumeration values. [SECURITY_IMPERSONATION_LEVEL]

member.name: F:Interop.ImpersonationLevel.Anonymous
member.summary: The server process cannot obtain identification information about the client and cannot impersonate the client. [SecurityAnonymous]

member.name: F:Interop.ImpersonationLevel.Identification
member.summary: The server process can obtain identification information about the client, but cannot impersonate the client. [SecurityIdentification]

member.name: F:Interop.ImpersonationLevel.Impersonation
member.summary: The server process can impersonate the client's security context on it's local system. [SecurityImpersonation]

member.name: F:Interop.ImpersonationLevel.Delegation
member.summary: The server process can impersonate the client's security context on remote systems. [SecurityDelegation]

member.name: F:Interop.ContextTrackingMode.Static
member.summary: The server is given a snapshot of the client's security context. [SECURITY_STATIC_TRACKING]

member.name: F:Interop.ContextTrackingMode.Dynamic
member.summary: The server is continually updated with changes. [SECURITY_DYNAMIC_TRACKING]

member.name: F:Interop.UNICODE_STRING.Length
member.summary: Length in bytes, not including the null terminator, if any.

member.name: F:Interop.UNICODE_STRING.MaximumLength
member.summary: Max size of the buffer in bytes

member.name: T:Interop.Advapi32.TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS
member.summary: TOKEN_INFORMATION_CLASS enumeration.
